context_bundle.summary: SQL injection prevention via parameterized queries/prepared statements. Keep user input separate from SQL code. Treat input as string literals, not executable SQL. OWASP primary defense.

onboarding.quick_start: NEVER concatenate user input into SQL. Use parameterized queries: PreparedStatement (Java), SqlCommand.Parameters (.NET), execute(?, [params]) (Python). Input becomes literal string, can't execute.
common_patterns: Java: PreparedStatement pstmt = conn.prepareStatement('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?'); pstmt.setInt(1, userId);
Python: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?', (userId,))
NEVER: 'SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ' + userId (vulnerable!)

known_errors.solution: Convert all queries to use parameterized/prepared statements
known_errors.prevention: Code review for string concat in SQL, automated scanning
